topic: Computer GK - Technology & Software / कंप्यूटर सामान्य ज्ञान

questions.question: Which Microsoft-based technology was built to link desktop applications to the World Wide Web? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: ActiveX is a Microsoft technology built to link desktop applications to the World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which among the following is the most common source of Viruses to the hard disk of your computer? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Incoming email is the most common source of viruses to computers.

questions.question: Symantec is the maker of which among the following popular antivirus software? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Symantec is the maker of Norton antivirus software.

questions.question: Which of the following lies within the CPU? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Primary Memory (RAM, Cache) lies within or directly interfaces with the CPU.

questions.question: "Internet escrow" is a term most commonly related to which of the following? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Internet escrow is most commonly related to E-commerce transactions.

questions.question: In the Windows XP, what does XP stands for? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: XP in Windows XP stands for eXPerience.

questions.question: V-RAM is used for access of the following? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: V-RAM (Video RAM) is used for accessing Video & Graphics data.

questions.question: The word bandwidth is also used to mean ________? [UGC NET 2019]
options: number of computers on a network
questions.explanation: Bandwidth also means the amount of data transferred over a network connection.

questions.question: Which among the following is correct about 4GL? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: 4GL stands for Fourth Generation Language, which is a type of programming language.

questions.question: Why should you be aware of the "Dictionary attack" in internet banking? [UGC NET 2019]
options: It is used to inject worms or viruses
It is used to determine a password
It accesses customer's account by determining other details
It is used for stealing info from Credit Card
questions.explanation: Dictionary attack is used to determine passwords by trying common words and combinations.

questions.question: Which of the following is not the basic capability of a computer? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Prediction is not a basic capability of a computer. Speed, Accuracy, and Processing are.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an input device of the computer? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: Sound Card is an internal component, not an input device.

questions.question: Which of the following is a single integrated circuit on which CPUs are typically constructed? [UGC NET 2019]
questions.explanation: A microprocessor is a single integrated circuit on which CPUs are constructed.

questions.question: What kind of data is processed by an analog computer?
questions.explanation: Analog computers process continuously varying data.

questions.question: In which of the following applications are analog computers used? [SSC CGL 2019]
options: Measurement of Resistance of a Capacitor
questions.explanation: Analog computers are used in all these measurement applications.

questions.question: Where are the instructions used to run a digital computer stored? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: Instructions used to run a digital computer are stored in Memory.

questions.question: What are four basic functional elements of a digital computer? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: All four — I/O Equipment, Main Memory, Control Unit and ALU — are basic functional elements.

questions.question: A device which is not connected to the CPU is known as? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: An off-line device is one that is not connected to the CPU.

questions.question: What is the full form of UPS? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: UPS stands for Uninterruptible Power System.

questions.question: Monitors, printers, disk drives, keyboard, mouse are included in which category? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: All these are physical components and hence fall under Hardware.

questions.question: What is the use of the wheel located between the two standard buttons on a mouse? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: The wheel on a mouse is used to scroll through pages and documents.

questions.question: Which type of failure occurs because of input device that does not read data correctly? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: A read error occurs when an input device does not read data correctly.

questions.question: Document reader and a light pen are classical examples of which of the following? [SSC CGL 2019]
questions.explanation: Document reader and light pen are classical examples of input devices.

questions.question: Which of the following consist of the computer main memory?
questions.explanation: Computer main memory consists of RAM and ROM.

questions.question: Which of the following is the ability of a system to jump directly to the requested data? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: Random Access is the ability to jump directly to the requested data.

questions.question: The smallest unit in which data can be stored is known by which name? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: A Bit (Binary Digit) is the smallest unit of data storage (0 or 1).

questions.question: Which of the following is the name given to the concentric circles on a diskette? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: Tracks are the concentric circles on a diskette/disk.

questions.question: What is the meaning of SMART commands in system maintenance? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: SMART stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

questions.question: Which act specifically exempts computer-maintenance activities for making copies of copyright files? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: The Digital Millennium Copyright Act exempts computer-maintenance activities.

questions.question: Copies of data or program files stored as a safety measure are called? [IBPS PO 2019]
questions.explanation: Backups are copies of data stored as a safety measure.

questions.question: What is the full form of UDF? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: UDF stands for Universal Disk Format.

questions.question: Which of the following is another name given to the LCD display?
questions.explanation: TFT (Thin Film Transistor) is another name for LCD display technology.

questions.question: Which of the following are hardware components of the computer system? [UPPSC 2025]
questions.explanation: Graphic Card, CPU, and Keyboard are all hardware components.

questions.question: Which of the following are software analysis and design tools? [UPPSC 2025]
questions.explanation: DFD, ER Diagrams, and HIPO Diagrams are all software analysis and design tools.

questions.question: Which graph determines deadlock situation occurrence? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: Resource Allocation Graph is used to determine deadlock situations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a Vector Graphics Editor?
questions.explanation: Corel Draw is a Vector Graphics Editor.

questions.question: What is the name given to any software included with new computer or hardware?
questions.explanation: Software included with new computer/hardware is called both Bundled and Pre-installed Software.

questions.question: Who invented the FORTRAN language? [UPPSC 2024]
questions.explanation: J.W. Backus invented the FORTRAN programming language.

questions.question: Which of the following are objects in Microsoft Access? [UPPSC 2024]
questions.explanation: Tables, Queries, and Reports are all objects in Microsoft Access.

questions.question: What does ARPANET stand for? [UPPSC 2024]
questions.explanation: ARPANET stands for Advanced Research Projects Agency Network.

questions.question: C is what kind of language? [UPPSC 2024]
options: A third generation high level language
questions.explanation: C is a third generation high level programming language.

questions.question: From which year 5th generation of computers is considered?
questions.explanation: 5th generation of computers is considered from 1980 onwards.

questions.question: Computer Monitor is also known as: [Anna University 2024]
questions.explanation: Computer Monitor is also known as VDU (Visual Display Unit).

questions.question: Arrange in ascending order: TB, KB, GB, MB [Anna University 2024]
questions.explanation: Ascending order: KB < MB < GB < TB. So TB > GB > MB > KB.

questions.question: Which one of these stores more data than a DVD?
questions.explanation: Blu-Ray Disk stores up to 50GB, much more than a DVD (4.7GB).

questions.question: The output shown on the computer monitor is called
questions.explanation: Output displayed on the computer monitor is called Soft Copy.

questions.question: 8 Bits make up 1 _____ [RRB Technician 2024]
questions.explanation: 8 Bits = 1 Byte.

questions.question: Which one is the result of the output given by a computer? [RRB Technician 2024]
questions.explanation: Information is the result of the output given by a computer after processing data.

questions.question: What is kind of CD-ROM? [RRB Technician 2024]
questions.explanation: CD-ROM is a type of Optical disk that uses laser technology to read data.

questions.question: Which is known as the most powerful type of computer?
questions.explanation: Super computer is the most powerful type of computer.

questions.question: Which is NOT a function of a microprocessor? [SSC 2024]
options: Controls the rest of the computer's components
questions.explanation: Keeping the system unit cool is done by fans/cooling systems, not the microprocessor.

questions.question: In Power Point, the Header & Footer button can be found on the insert tab in what group? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: The Header & Footer button is in the Text group on the Insert tab.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of primary storage? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: RAM, ROM, and Static RAM are all types of primary storage.

questions.question: www stands for? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: www stands for World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of CPU? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: CPU components are Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) and Control Unit.

questions.question: What is the name of a device that converts digital signals to analog signals? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: A Modem (Modulator-Demodulator) converts digital signals to analog and vice versa.

questions.question: Where is RAM located? [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: RAM is located on the Motherboard.

questions.question: Charles Babbage designed the first mechanical computer named [SSC 2024]
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage designed the Analytical Engine, the first mechanical computer.

questions.question: If a computer provides database services to others, then it will be known as? [RRB Technician 2024]
questions.explanation: A computer providing database services is called a Database server.

questions.question: Full form of URL is? [RRB Technician 2024]
questions.explanation: URL stands for Uniform Resource Locator.

questions.question: An Assembler is used to translate a program written in?
questions.explanation: An Assembler translates programs written in Assembly Language to machine code.

questions.question: Technology used to provide internet by transmitting data over wires of telephone network is? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: DSL (Digital Subscriber Line) provides internet over telephone network wires.

questions.question: Which level language is Assembly Language? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: Assembly Language is a Low-level programming language.

questions.question: Documents, Movies, images and photographs etc are stored at a? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: Documents, movies, images are stored on a File server.

questions.question: Which of the following is used in RAM? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: Semi Conductors are used in modern RAM chips.

questions.question: What is the full form of GUI in terms of computers? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: GUI stands for Graphical User Interface.

questions.question: What is the full form of ALU? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: ALU stands for Arithmetic Logic Unit.

questions.question: Who was the father of internet? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: Vint Cerf is known as the father of the internet.

questions.question: Verification is process of? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: Verification is the process of authentication.

questions.question: What is LINUX? [SSC 2023]
questions.explanation: LINUX is an open-source Operating System.

questions.question: Which among following is an image name extension?
questions.explanation: .gif is an image file extension (Graphics Interchange Format).

questions.question: Which is most common language used in web designing?
questions.explanation: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the most common language for web designing.

questions.question: Who is also known as father of computer? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage is known as the father of computers.

questions.question: Which language is commonly used in Android applications? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: Java is the most commonly used language in Android applications.

questions.question: What is the full form of HTTP? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: HTTP stands for Hyper Text Transfer Protocol.

questions.question: Which among the following is odd? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: BIOS is firmware, not a storage device like the others.

questions.question: Which operations are performed by RAM? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: RAM performs both Read and Write operations.

questions.question: Which is responsible for specifying address of a memory location? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: Address Bus is responsible for specifying the address of a memory location.

questions.question: Which is responsible for finding and loading operating system into RAM? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: Bootstrap loader is responsible for loading the operating system into RAM.

questions.question: What is the full form of RAM? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: RAM stands for Random Access Memory.

questions.question: What is the full form of TIFF? [RRB Group D 2022]
questions.explanation: TIFF stands for Tagged Image File Format.

questions.question: Computer resolution measures?
questions.explanation: Computer resolution is measured by the number of pixels displayed on screen.

questions.question: Which are the main parts of central processing unit?
options: Control unit and Arithmetic Logic Unit
questions.explanation: The main parts of CPU are Control Unit and Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU).

questions.question: Who is known as father of Artificial Intelligence? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: John McCarthy is known as the father of Artificial Intelligence.

questions.question: USB is which type of storage device? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: USB is a Tertiary type of storage device.

questions.question: Which program is run by BIOS to check hardware components when computer starts? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: POST (Power-On Self-Test) is run by BIOS to check hardware at startup.

questions.question: ROM is non volatile - True or False? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: ROM (Read Only Memory) is non-volatile, meaning it retains data even when power is off.

questions.question: What is full form of CMOS? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: CMOS stands for Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor.

questions.question: Second generation of computers consist of? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: Second generation computers used Transistors (1956-1963).

questions.question: MPG is a file extension of which type of files? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: MPG is a Video file extension (MPEG format).

questions.question: What is the full form of SMPS? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: SMPS stands for Switch Mode Power Supply.

questions.question: Who invented Java? [UPSC 2022]
questions.explanation: James Gosling invented the Java programming language.

questions.question: Which operating system is developed by Apple?
questions.explanation: Mac OS (macOS) is the operating system developed by Apple.

questions.question: Where is BIOS stored? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: BIOS is stored in a Flash Memory Chip on the motherboard.

questions.question: What is the full form of EXIF? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: EXIF stands for Exchangeable Image File Format.

questions.question: BIOS is used for? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: BIOS is primarily used for loading the operating system.

questions.question: 1 mega byte is equal to [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: 1 Megabyte = 1024 Kilobytes.

questions.question: An electronic path that sends signals from one part of computer to another is? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: A Bus is an electronic path that sends signals between components of a computer.

questions.question: Which is odd one? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: Hard Disk is secondary storage while RAM, ROM, and Cache are primary memory.

questions.question: Which device is used for sending digital data over a phone line? [SSC CGL 2022]
questions.explanation: Modem is used for sending digital data over a phone line.
